DataElement.preferredName: RT Dose Reference Point Coordinate Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Coordinates (x,y,z) of Reference Point in the patient based coordinate system described in C.7.6.2.1.1 (mm).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Dose Reference Point Coordinate
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time._Something referred to; the object of a reference._The precise location of something; a spatially limited location._A number or other designation that identifies a position relative to an axis or grid.

ReferenceDocuments.name: DICOM Reference
ReferenceDocuments.description: PS 3.3-2011: Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine (DICOM), Part 3: Information Object Definitions

ReferenceDocuments.name: DICOM Condition
ReferenceDocuments.description: Required if Dose Reference Structure Type (300A,0014) is COORDINATES

ReferenceDocuments.name: DICOM Note
ReferenceDocuments.description: PS 3.3-2011 - C.7.6.2.1.1: The Image Position (0020,0032) specifies the x, y, and z coordinates of the upper left hand corner of the image; it is the center of the first voxel transmitted. Image Orientation (0020,0037) specifies the direction cosines of the first row and the first column with respect to the patient. These Attributes shall be provide as a pair. Row value for the x, y, and z axes respectively followed by the Column value for the x, y, and z axes respectively.
